issues.description: The Stock.take method in the template repository returns a boolean, but the problem specification’s UML (and the reference solution) expect it to return an int (remaining quantity or -1 on failure). This mismatch will confuse students when they try to implement checkOrderReady or compare take(...) == -1.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template’s Stock.take signature to return an int instead of a boolean, returning the updated quantity or -1 if the ingredient is unavailable.
